input.report:
02/01/2025, 00:00, PET-CT

Case History:

Reason for Request: Benign presentation. No previous oncology history.

Findings: Resolved febrile illness. Blood counts normalized. No organomegaly. Clinical improvement noted. No malignancy identified. Reassurance provided.

Dr Sarah Mitchell, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 02/01/2025, 00:00

26/10/2025, 00:00, PET-CT

Case History:

Reason for Request: Palpable mass. Suspected Brain Tumor - Medulloblastoma.

From clinical notes: Brain Tumor - Medulloblastoma. Paediatric oncology assessment.

Findings: posterior fossa mass with enhancement and hydrocephalus. Restricted diffusion. High-grade medulloblastoma on histology. Recommend MDT discussion and treatment planning.

Dr Sarah Mitchell, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 26/10/2025, 00:00

03/07/2025, 00:00, CT CHEST/ABDOMEN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Follow-up post-treatment. No previous oncology history.

Findings: Reactive lymphadenopathy secondary to viral infection. Node size decreasing on follow-up. No atypical features. No malignancy identified. Reassurance provided.

Dr Sophie Richardson, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 03/07/2025, 00:00

27/02/2025, 00:00, MRI BRAIN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Palpable mass. Suspected Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma.

From clinical notes: Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma. Paediatric oncology assessment.

Findings: abdominal lymphadenopathy with mesenteric and retroperitoneal nodes. Burkitt lymphoma confirmed on biopsy. High LDH levels. Recommend MDT discussion and treatment planning.

Dr Michael Taylor, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 27/02/2025, 00:00

04/05/2025, 00:00, ULTRASOUND

Case History:

Reason for Request: Pancytopenia. Suspected Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia.

From clinical notes: Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia. Paediatric oncology assessment.

Findings: bone marrow infiltration with lymphoblasts comprising 85% of nucleated cells. Immunophenotyping consistent with B-cell ALL. CNS involvement negative. Recommend MDT discussion and treatment planning.

Dr Emma Wilson, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 04/05/2025, 00:00

17/09/2025, 00:00, MRI BRAIN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Routine surveillance. No previous oncology history.

Findings: Reactive lymphadenopathy secondary to viral infection. Node size decreasing on follow-up. No atypical features. No malignancy identified. Reassurance provided.

Dr James Chen, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 17/09/2025, 00:00

11/07/2025, 00:00, CT CHEST/ABDOMEN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Lymphadenopathy. Suspected Neuroblastoma.

From clinical notes: Neuroblastoma. Paediatric oncology assessment.

Findings: large heterogeneous suprarenal mass with calcifications. MIBG avidity present. Elevated urinary catecholamines. Stage III disease. Recommend MDT discussion and treatment planning.

Dr Rachel Patel, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 11/07/2025, 00:00

21/03/2025, 00:00, MRI BRAIN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Rule out malignancy. No previous oncology history.

Findings: Normal chest radiograph. Clear lung fields. No mediastinal mass. Heart size normal. No malignancy identified. Reassurance provided.

Dr Sarah Mitchell, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 21/03/2025, 00:00

08/02/2025, 00:00, X-RAY

Case History:

Reason for Request: Rule out malignancy. No previous oncology history.

Findings: Normal CBC with age-appropriate values. No blast cells. Platelets adequate. Hemoglobin within normal limits. No malignancy identified. Reassurance provided.

Dr James Chen, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 08/02/2025, 00:00

25/04/2025, 00:00, CT CHEST/ABDOMEN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Pancytopenia. Suspected Wilms Tumor.

From clinical notes: Wilms Tumor. Paediatric oncology assessment.

Findings: large heterogeneous left renal mass with pseudocapsule. No vascular invasion. Favorable histology on biopsy. Stage II. Recommend MDT discussion and treatment planning.

Dr Sophie Richardson, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 25/04/2025, 00:00

26/12/2025, 00:00, X-RAY

Case History:

Reason for Request: Pancytopenia. Suspected Hodgkin Lymphoma.

From clinical notes: Hodgkin Lymphoma. Paediatric oncology assessment.

Findings: mediastinal lymphadenopathy with bulky anterior mediastinal mass. PET-CT showing FDG-avid nodes. Classical Hodgkin, nodular sclerosing type. Recommend MDT discussion and treatment planning.

Dr Sophie Richardson, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 26/12/2025, 00:00

18/09/2025, 00:00, PET-CT

Case History:

Reason for Request: Pancytopenia. Suspected Neuroblastoma.

From clinical notes: Neuroblastoma. Paediatric oncology assessment.

Findings: large heterogeneous suprarenal mass with calcifications. MIBG avidity present. Elevated urinary catecholamines. Stage III disease. Recommend MDT discussion and treatment planning.

Dr Emma Wilson, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 18/09/2025, 00:00

15/12/2025, 00:00, PET-CT

Case History:

Reason for Request: Pancytopenia. Suspected Hepatoblastoma.

From clinical notes: Hepatoblastoma. Paediatric oncology assessment.

Findings: large heterogeneous hepatic mass with elevated AFP. Fetal histology subtype. PRETEXT stage II. Recommend MDT discussion and treatment planning.

Dr Rachel Patel, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 15/12/2025, 00:00

26/02/2025, 00:00, CT CHEST/ABDOMEN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Palpable mass. Suspected Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis.

From clinical notes: Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis. Paediatric oncology assessment.

Findings: multiple lytic skull lesions with soft tissue component. CD1a and Langerin positive. Multisystem disease. Recommend MDT discussion and treatment planning.

Dr Sophie Richardson, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 26/02/2025, 00:00

08/09/2025, 00:00, MRI BRAIN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Screening. No previous oncology history.

Findings: Post-viral lymphocytosis. Atypical lymphocytes resolving. Monospot positive. EBV serology confirms. No malignancy identified. Reassurance provided.

Dr Emma Wilson, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 08/09/2025, 00:00

14/07/2025, 00:00, BONE MARROW BIOPSY

Case History:

Reason for Request: Bone pain. Suspected Acute Myeloid Leukemia.

From clinical notes: Acute Myeloid Leukemia. Paediatric oncology assessment.

Findings: myeloblasts accounting for 70% of marrow cellularity. Cytogenetic analysis reveals t(8;21) translocation. Favorable risk category. Recommend MDT discussion and treatment planning.

Dr Sarah Mitchell, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 14/07/2025, 00:00

07/10/2025, 00:00, BONE MARROW BIOPSY

Case History:

Reason for Request: Unexplained fever and weight loss. Suspected Rhabdomyosarcoma.

From clinical notes: Rhabdomyosarcoma. Paediatric oncology assessment.

Findings: parameningeal mass with intracranial extension. Embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma on biopsy. PAX-FOXO1 fusion negative. Recommend MDT discussion and treatment planning.

Dr Rachel Patel, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 07/10/2025, 00:00

06/04/2025, 00:00, BONE MARROW BIOPSY

Case History:

Reason for Request: Screening. No previous oncology history.

Findings: Normal chest radiograph. Clear lung fields. No mediastinal mass. Heart size normal. No malignancy identified. Reassurance provided.

Dr Rachel Patel, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 06/04/2025, 00:00

Dr Sophie Richardson, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 23/05/2025, 00:00

Case History:

Findings: large heterogeneous suprarenal mass with calcifications. MIBG avidity present. Elevated urinary catecholamines. Stage III disease. Recommend MDT discussion and treatment planning.

Dr James Chen, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 09/07/2025, 00:00

Case History:

Reason for Request: Pancytopenia. Suspected Wilms Tumor.

Findings: large heterogeneous left renal mass with pseudocapsule. No vascular invasion. Favorable histology on biopsy. Stage II. Recommend MDT discussion and treatment planning.

Dr Sarah Mitchell, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 18/08/2025, 00:00

13/03/2025, 00:00, PET-CT

Case History:

Reason for Request: Routine surveillance. No previous oncology history.

Findings: Normal brain MRI for age. No mass lesion. No abnormal enhancement. Headaches attributed to migraine. No malignancy identified. Reassurance provided.

Dr James Chen, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 13/03/2025, 00:00

16/05/2025, 00:00, BONE MARROW BIOPSY

Case History:

Reason for Request: Unexplained fever and weight loss. Suspected Ewing Sarcoma.

From clinical notes: Ewing Sarcoma. Paediatric oncology assessment.

Findings: permeative bone destruction in left femoral diaphysis with large soft tissue mass. Onion-skin periosteal reaction. EWSR1 fusion positive. Recommend MDT discussion and treatment planning.

Dr Sophie Richardson, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 16/05/2025, 00:00

25/06/2025, 00:00, CT CHEST/ABDOMEN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Routine surveillance. No previous oncology history.

Findings: Healing fracture - normal process. No pathological features. Bone density normal. Trauma history consistent. No malignancy identified. Reassurance provided.

Dr Sophie Richardson, Consultant Paediatric Oncologist 25/06/2025, 00:00

01/07/2025, 00:00, ULTRASOUND

Case History:

Reason for Request: Rule out malignancy. No previous oncology history.
